CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-4 - Procedural guarantees of review);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-5 - Compensation)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , who was born in DATE , lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was taken into police custody on suspicion of membership of an illegal organisation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigating judge at ORG , after questioning the applicant , ordered his pre - trial detention .
CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE public prosecutor filed an indictment with ORG .
CARDINAL . The trial commenced before ORG and the first preparatory hearing was held on DATE .
CARDINAL . In the subsequent hearings held DATE and DATE , the applicant appeared before the court and the judges ordered his continued detention .

CARDINAL . The applicant filed an objection against the decision of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the CARDINALth Chamber of ORG dismissed this objection without holding an oral hearing , and based on the public prosecutor ’s written opinion , which had not been communicated to the applicant or his representative .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was released from detention on remand .
CARDINAL . According to the latest information in the case - file , the proceedings against the applicant are still pending before the first - instance court .
